intro: Clompanus chicha, commonly known as the Chicha plant, is a species native to the Andean region of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a reddish tint and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its unique appearance and cultural significance, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
